Today is #RuralBroadbandDay! Broadband access is essential for economic and educational opportunities in Greater MN, and here in #MN02 we are leading efforts to expand access to help all of our communities and economies grow. Here are a few examples:

Trade & transportation policies decided in DC have impacts back home. This week, the House passed the bipartisan Family Farmer Relief Act, a bill I cosponsored to give farmers more flexibility in debt relief during these uncertain economic times. It doesn’t solve everything, but it’s a critical step toward giving farmers the certainty they need.

Supporting our farm economy means helping beginning farmers start successful operations. Over 20K Minnesotans are at risk of losing their pensions. This week, the House took a big step toward changing that. Proud to cosponsor and vote to pass the #ButchLewisAct to strengthen and protect the pensions of our hardworking employees in multi-employer plans. pic.twitter.com/sVXKpL3far

My casework team has been traveling across the district holding mobile office hours - helping you answer questions on everything from student debt to Medicare. If you need help navigating government services, my team will be at Cottage Grove City Hall at 5PM today! pic.twitter.com/TOvj4MA23D

Minnesotans are tired of robocalls that spam their phones and prey on consumers for financial gain. Proud to have cosponsored and voted for the #StopBadRobocalls Act to crack down on bad actors and create more transparency for consumers.
Today, I was proud to see the House pass the Autism Cares Act of 2019, a bill that will invest in autism research and help us better understand and support those on the spectrum.

I was honored to be joined by @RodneyDavis, @RepDinaTitus, and several local mayors (including Mayor Dowse of Red Wing!) to celebrate the introduction of this landmark bill that will give #MN02 communities low interest loans to strengthen critical infrastructure.

I introduced this bipartisan bill after hearing from mayors across the district who were impacted by severe flooding & other natural disasters. We need to make disaster resilience efforts a priority, and I'm proud to bring the local priorities of #MN02 to the halls of Congress!

I'm proud to work with @RodneyDavis to introduce the Resilient Communities Revolving Fund Act of 2019, a landmark bill that works with FEMA to provide low interest loans to states, counties, and townships to implement disaster prevention projects. https://craig.house.gov/media/press-releases/reps-angie-craig-rodney-davis-introduce-bipartisan-disaster-prevention-bill …

Don’t forget! My seventh Town Hall is tomorrow at 3:30 PM at the Apple Valley Senior Center (14601 Hayes Road, Apple Valley MN 55124) and will feature a panel discussion and Q&A on healthcare, as well as an open Q&A period at the end. Hope to see you there!

I also supported an amendment to launch a study of these wage increases, so that we make sure we understand how they impact our local communities.

Working families have seen stagnant or falling wages for far too long in this country. That has to change. I voted today to increase the federal minimum wage to $15 over the next 6 years, starting at $8.40 when the bill is signed into law.

I voted this week to repeal the Cadillac Tax, a tax on employer-sponsored healthcare plans that would ultimately fall on workers. If you give up pay for a better health plan, you shouldn’t be taxed for it. pic.twitter.com/qWjBVLBL1F

Today, @TransportDems heard from families of victims of recent Boeing Max crashes. I asked how Congress and the FAA can create more robust systems to monitor and report near misses or “red flags” before they result in tragedy. I will continue advocating for changes to save lives.

Public transit investments are essential for connecting Minnesotans to their communities and to economic opportunity. Today, in a @TransportDems hearing, I got to talk about the Orange Line, one of Minnesota’s new public transit projects that will run right through Burnsville!

Grateful to have John Zimmerman, a turkey farmer from Northfield, testify on behalf of @MinnesotaTurkey in @HouseAgDems today! I always love having my neighbors from #MN02 in Washington to make sure the voices of our farmers are prioritized in Congress. pic.twitter.com/XdOiEspxUw

Yesterday, we passed several bills to support the small businesses of #MN02 - including bipartisan bills I cosponsored to expand resources for cybersecurity and increase funds for disaster loans. Proud to be advocating for policies to drive economic growth for Minnesotans!

Congratulations to @BurnsvilleMN, @BurnsvillePD, BVChamber & @ISD191 on a historic moment for the City of Burnsville - for the first time, all of the city’s leaders are women. Congrats and thank you for all you do!

I stand with Amazon workers striking today. Part of what makes our country great is the right to organize and advocate for better working conditions. Amazon has a responsibility to address these concerns and ensure their employees work under fair, safe working conditions.

I had the opportunity today to visit the National Institutes of Health to see firsthand the groundbreaking research they are doing to solve some of our biggest health challenges. pic.twitter.com/QmGotg2YcG

The Army Corps of Engineers works to maintain infrastructure on waterways like the Mississippi River that farmers and businesses rely on. In this week's @TransportDems hearing, we heard how Congress can support these efforts & strengthen infrastructure for all of our communities.

Investing in quality healthcare is a top priority for this Congress, and I’m proud to be a part of this critical effort. This week, bills to support workforce development for nurses and increase funding for autism research passed out of @EnergyCommerce.

Congratulations to South Saint Paul’s Fleming Field Airport on being awarded @USDOT funds to invest in critical infrastructure improvements. I’m proud to be advocating for local infrastructure investments like this that strengthen Minnesota’s economies.

Today, I voted to permanently reauthorize the 9/11 Victim Compensation fund to ensure victims have the financial security they deserve. I cosponsored this bill because we must live up to our commitment to first responders, survivors, & families affected by this national tragedy.

We need to be focused on increasing protections for patients and healthcare access for families, not rolling them back. That’s why I’m focused on common sense solutions to build upon our existing system and expand healthcare access for Minnesota families.

Today, oral arguments begin in the Texas v. United States lawsuit that will determine whether we maintain protections for people with pre-existing conditions and other critical features of the Affordable Care Act for working families.

Red Wing folks - be sure to check out these workshops! It's great to see cities working to support our small businesses, and it’s why I was proud to support a bill to increase $$ for the Small Business Administration’s Entrepreneurial Development Programs. https://bit.ly/30tNxsb

The mistreatment of children and families at the border goes against our values as a country. We can have fair, firm immigration policies without subjecting children and families to traumatic and inhumane living conditions. We must continue speaking out against these policies.

Thanks for having me! I always love meeting with the hardworking farmers of #MN02. https://twitter.com/mncorn/status/1146132722127187970 …

Every day we learn more about mistreatment of children & families seeking legal entry at the border. Immigration policies must treat people coming to this country with humanity and respect. We must stop playing politics with immigration & move to comprehensive immigration reform.
